multiScroll.js customized with Auto-height

Introduction

This customization provides a way to add a non full-screen footer for a multiScroll.js website.
The footer will be accessible through an anchor link, navigation bullet or scrolling down with the mouse wheel, touch pointer or keyboard.

HTML Markup

In order to create the auto-height / footer section a div with the class ms-auto-height will have to be added outside the pluginâ€™s wrapper and just after it.

For example:

<div id="multiscroll">
    <div class="ms-left">
        <div class="ms-section">Some section</div>
        <div class="ms-section">Some section</div>
        <div class="ms-section">Some section</div>
    </div>
    <div class="ms-right">
        <div class="ms-section">Some section</div>
        <div class="ms-section">Some section</div>
        <div class="ms-section">Some section</div>
    </div>
</div>
<div class="ms-auto-height">
    Demo
</div>

Plugin initialization

The plugin will be initialized in the same way as the original multiScroll.js. No changes need to be done there.

Plugin options

The new auto-height section It will be treated as another section and therefore it will require another entry in options such as navigationTooltips or anchors.

Setting a fixed height

CSS can be used to set a fixed height for the auto-height section
For example:

<div class="ms-auto-height myFooter">
    Demo
</div>
.myFooter{
    background: red;
    height: 350px;
}
